note.p: Education: Jesuit school in Lyons; Toulouse
Career: Tutor to the Noailles family; lived in Paris (1696-1697); Professor of Hydrography at Rochefort; Deputy Director of Banque General (1716-1718)
Authority: Altnernative spelling Langny taken from the Record
References: A Rupert Hall, 'Further Newton Correspondence' in NR 1982-83 vol 37 pp 7-34
Notes: Proposed by Abraham de Moivre. DSB gives death date as 11 April 1734
